data.test_name: Classification of Elements and Periodicity in Properties Test - 4

1.q_string: The elements with atomic numbers 9, 17, 35, 53 and 85 are all:
Amongst the following elements (whose electronic configurations are given below), the one having the highest ionization enthalpy is:
The polarizing power of the anions N3-, O2- and F-, follows the order:
Which of the following is a set of isoelectronic species (At. No. of Cs = 55, Br = 35)?

q_option: Atomic radius and electron gain enthalpy (negative value)
Ionisation enthalpy and electron gain enthalpy (negative value)
1.q_string: Which of the following pairs show reverse properties on moving along a period from left to right and from top to bottom in a group:

Consider the following statements:

(I) Rutherford name was associated with the development of periodic table.

(II) A metal \(\mathrm{M}\) having electronic configuration \(1 s^{2}, 2 p^{6}, 3 s^{2}\), \(3 p^{6}, 3 d^{10}, 4 s^{1}\) is \(\mathrm{d}\)-block element.

(III) Diamond is not an element.

(IV) The electronic configuration of the most electronegative element is \(1 s^{2}, 2 s^{2}, 2 p^{6}\)

Select the correct option from the above given codes:

q_option: Statement 1 is incorrect, and statement 2 is correct.
1.q_string:
Which statements about Group I and Group VII elements are correct?

1. In Group I, lithium is more reactive than potassium.

2. In Group VIII, chlorine is more reactive than fluorine.

q_option: If both statements are CORRECT, and Statement II is the CORRECT explanation of Statement I.
If both statements are CORRECT, and Statement II is NOT the CORRECT explanation of Statement I.
If Statement I is CORRECT, but Statement II is INCORRECT.
If Statement I is INCORRECT, but Statement II is CORRECT.
1.q_string:
Statement I: In \(\mathrm{ClF} F_{3}\), chlorine has the oxidation number - 1 .

Statement II: Electron affinity of chorine is greater than that of fluorine.
The electronic structure of zinc \((Z=30)\) is \(2,8,18,2\). The electronic structure of gallium \((Z=31)\) will be:

q_option: Of the extra stability of half-filled p orbitals in nitrogen
The former contains less number of electrons
1.q_string: The ionization enthalpy of nitrogen is more than that of oxygen because of:
Which of the following electronic configurations corresponds to the element with the largest negative electron gain enthalpy?
Which of the following orders is not correct according to the property written against it?

q_option: \(\mathrm{A}\) is a non-metal and \(\mathrm{B}\) is coinage metal
\(\mathrm{A}\) is a coinage metal and \(\mathrm{B}\) is non-metal
1.q_string: Element Aand \(\mathrm{B}\) with their respective electronic configurations \(3 d^{10} 4 s^{1}\) and \(4 d^{10} 5 s^{1}\) in their outermost shell are:

q_option: Depends on the number of valence electrons
1.q_string: Refer to change in the properties of elements on moving from left to right across a period of the Periodic Table. For each property, choose the correct answer. The electronegativity:
Metal T reacts with water to produce a colourless solution. A white precipitate is produced when this colourless solution is mixed with aqueous sulfuric acid. What is metal T?
Which pair of elements will react together most violently?
Outer configuration of \(X\) is \(3 \mathrm{~d}^{5}, 4 \mathrm{~s}^{1}\). It belongs to group number:

Identify the correct order in which the ionic radius of the following ions increases.

(I) \(\mathrm{F}^{-}\)

(II) \(\mathrm{Na}^{+}\)

\((\mathrm{III}) \mathrm{N}^{3-}\)

q_option: Electron affinity of fluorine is more than chlorine.
Electron affinities of noble gases are high.
Electron affinity of non-metals are low and those of metals are high.
Electron affinity of element having \(d^{10} s^{2}\) configuration is negative.
1.q_string: Pick up the correct statement:
Which of the following isoelectronic ions has the lowest ionization energy?
The smog is essentially caused by the presence of:

q_option: Increases across a period from left to right and decreases down a group
Increases across a period from left to right and increases down a group
Decreases across a period from left to right and decreases down a group
decreases across a period from left to right and increases down a group

The correct order for the decrease in atomic radii is:
